results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Pop and Rock Music;McVie, Christine;Fleetwood Mac
results.byline: By Jim Farber
results.title: Christine McVie, Hitmaker for Fleetwood Mac, Is Dead at 79
results.abstract: As a singer, songwriter and keyboardist, she was a prolific force behind one of the most popular rock bands of the last 50 years.

media.caption: Christine McVie of Fleetwood Mac in performance at Madison Square Garden in 2014. Her commercial potency was on full display on Fleetwood Mac’s “Greatest Hits” anthology: She either wrote or co-wrote half of its 16 tracks.

results.adx_keywords: Fashion and Apparel;Child Abuse and Neglect;Child Pornography;Advertising and Marketing;audio-neutral-informative;audio-negative-sad;Gvasalia, Demna;Galimberti, Gabriele;Balenciaga (Fashion Label)
results.byline: By Elizabeth Paton, Vanessa Friedman and Jessica Testa
results.title: When High Fashion and QAnon Collide
results.abstract: Two new Balenciaga campaigns ignited a firestorm that traveled from the internet to Fox News, fueled by allegations that the brand condoned child exploitation.

media.caption: The fallout began on Nov. 16, when Balenciaga published a campaign called Balenciaga Gift Shop, which featured images of children with the brand’s handbags that look like teddy bears in bondage gear.

results.title: The 10 Best Books of 2022

results.adx_keywords: Mental Health and Disorders;Hospitals;Homeless Persons;Psychiatry and Psychiatrists;Adams, Eric L;New York City
results.byline: By Andy Newman and Emma G. Fitzsimmons
results.title: New York City to Involuntarily Remove Mentally Ill People From Streets
results.abstract: Mayor Eric Adams directed the police and emergency medical workers to hospitalize people they deemed too mentally ill to care for themselves, even if they posed no threat to others.

media.caption: In a speech on Tuesday, Mayor Eric Adams issued a directive telling city agencies to transport people with severe mental illness to hospitals.
media.copyright: Benjamin Norman for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Royal Families;Black People;Charles III, King of the United Kingdom;Elizabeth II, Queen of Great Britain;Harry, Duke of Sussex;Buckingham Palace;Great Britain
results.byline: By Mark Landler
results.title: Buckingham Palace Staff Member Resigns Over Remarks to Black Guest
results.abstract: The founder of an antiviolence support group said an aide pressed her on where she was from, dismissing Britain as an answer. The palace called the questioning “unacceptable and deeply regrettable.”
per_facet: Charles III, King of the United Kingdom
Elizabeth II, Queen of Great Britain

results.adx_keywords: Kidnapping and Hostages;Babies and Infants;Missing Persons;DNA (Deoxyribonucleic Acid);Genealogy;National Center for Missing and Exploited Children;Fort Worth (Tex)
results.byline: By Jesus Jiménez
results.title: A Baby Abduction, a DNA Match and a Tearful Reunion 51 Years Later
results.abstract: A Fort Worth woman learned she was “Baby Melissa,” the focus of a decades-long search. “I finally have a mother and a father that want me,” she said.
org_facet: National Center for Missing and Exploited Children

media.caption: Melanie Walden, who was born Melissa Highsmith, with her mother, Alta Apantenco, left, and her father, Jeffrie Highsmith, at a LabCorp testing facility in Fort Worth on Saturday.

results.byline: By Annie Karni and Emily Cochrane
results.title: In a Show of Unity, House Democrats Elect Hakeem Jeffries Minority Leader
results.abstract: A new trio, including Representatives Katherine Clark of Massachusetts as No. 2 and Pete Aguilar of California as No. 3, will take the reins in January, replacing Speaker Nancy Pelosi and her team.

results.adx_keywords: Treason and Sedition;Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);Right-Wing Extremism and Alt-Right;Presidential Election of 2020;United States Politics and Government;Decisions and Verdicts;Rhodes, Stewart (1966- );Caldwell, Thomas Edward;Harrelson, Kenneth (1980- );Meggs, Kelly (1969- );Watkins, Jessica Marie;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Trump, Donald J;Oath Keepers;Justice Department
results.byline: By Alan Feuer and Zach Montague
results.title: Oath Keepers Leader Convicted of Sedition in Landmark Jan. 6 Case
results.abstract: A jury in federal court in Washington convicted Stewart Rhodes, the leader of the far-right militia, and one of his subordinates for a plot to keep Donald Trump in power.

media.caption: Stewart Rhodes, the leader of the Oath Keepers militia, in 2016. His conviction is the first successful sedition prosecution since 1995.

results.adx_keywords: Tax Evasion;Frauds and Swindling;Family Business;Trump, Donald J;Weisselberg, Allen;Trump Organization
results.byline: By Ben Protess, Jonah E. Bromwich and William K. Rashbaum
results.title: Verdict in Trump Organization Trial Could Come Down to 3 Little Words
results.abstract: What jurors make of the phrase “in behalf of” could decide whether the former president’s namesake company is guilty of tax fraud.

media.caption: Donald J. Trump’s company provided fancy perks to executives, who did not pay taxes on them.
media.copyright: Josh Ritchie for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Politics and Government;Jiang Zemin;Communist Party of China;China
results.byline: By Chris Buckley and Michael Wines
results.title: Jiang Zemin, Leader Who Guided China Into Global Market, Dies at 96
results.abstract: Mr. Jiang, a wily and garrulous politician, presided over a decade of meteoric economic growth in the post-Tiananmen era.

media.caption: Jiang Zemin in Hong Kong in 1998. As China’s leader, Mr. Jiang amassed influence that endured long past his formal retirement, giving him a major say in picking the current leader, Xi Jinping.

results.title: In Georgia, Walker’s Pace in the Finish Worries Republican Allies

results.byline: By Dennis Overbye
results.title: Physicists Create ‘the Smallest, Crummiest Wormhole You Can Imagine’
results.abstract: Scientists used a quantum computer to explore the ultimate escape route from a black hole.

media.caption: One clue that the researchers were actually recording “wormholelike” behavior was that signals emerged from the other end of the wormhole in the order that they went in.

results.byline: By Elie Dolgin
results.title: Ashkenazi Jews Have Become More Genetically Similar Over Time
results.abstract: A new study of skeletons from a cemetery in Germany reveals a hidden history of Jews in the Middle Ages.

media.caption: A depiction of a synagogue in Erfurt, Germany, in the 14th century. “In the middle of the German-speaking lands, this was the place to be at the time,” said the curator of Erfurt’s Old Synagogue Museum.

results.byline: By Paul Mozur, Muyi Xiao and John Liu
results.title: ‘Breach of the Big Silence’: Protests Stretch China’s Censorship to Its Limits
results.abstract: Days later, videos of chants and confrontations are still visible on the Chinese internet. It’s a sign of how a groundswell outmatched the world’s best internet control system.

results.byline: By Hurubie Meko
results.title: How to Watch the Christmas Tree Lighting at Rockefeller Center
results.abstract: The 90th annual celebration will take place on Wednesday and feature performances by Gwen Stefani, Alicia Keys, Blake Shelton and others.

media.caption: This year’s Christmas tree, from Queensbury, N.Y., is 82 feet tall and weighs almost 14 tons.
